summary:
Academics:
- Graduated VWO at Sint Nicolaas Lyceum, Amsterdam. 
- Graduated with a double major in Health & Nature and Nature & Technology with extra subject    economics and German as a foreing language. 
- Every year ended with an 8 on average (out of 10). 
- Speaks three languages: Dutch (fluent), English (fluent), and German (average).
- Graduated Bachelors degree from Whittier College with a double major in Mathematics & Economics and Business Administration. 
- Graduated Bachelors degree Summa Cum Laude (above 3.90 GPA) from Whittier College

Academic Achievements:
- 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022: Invited for Presidents’ Lunch, with the president (Linda Oubre) of Whittier College for excelling both academically and in sports. 
- 2018-2022: Part of PSALA (Poet Student Athlete Leadership Academy).
- 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022: Named ITA Scholar-Athlete, must have a GPA over 3.5 and must be listed on instituional elegibility form. 
- 2022: Recipiant of the Charles R. Laine Award for Outstanding Graduate In Business Administration (highest GPA of all Business Administration graduates, regardless of the concentration).
- 2022: Recipiant of the Outstanding Academic Achievement in Mathematics-Economics Certificate ((highest GPA of all Mathematics-Economics graduates).
- 2022: Recipient of the Distinction in the Economics Major Certificate (highest GPA of all Economics graduates).
- 2022: Recipiant of the Oustanding Academic Achievement in Business Administration Certificate (highest GPA of all Business Administration graduates, without a concentration).
- 2022: Recipiant of Top Scholar Athlete Certificate (For excellence in the Classroom and having a Cumulative GPA of a 3.7 or Higher).
- 2022: Recipiant of the 2022 Presidential Scholar Athlete of the Year (Four-Year Letterwinner, 4.0 Cumulative GPA)(this award is usually given to the athlete with the highest GPA). 

Work Experience:
- October 2015: Two weeks of volunteer work in Cebu City, the Phillipines with the organization Worldmapping. 
- 2014- present: Own racket stringing service (tennis rackets) 
- 2012-2015: Soccer coach of a team with children aged 8-10. 
- 2017-2018: Tennis Coach at tennis school Drive-ITT for children aged 10-14. 
- 2018- present: Volunteering for Special Olympics (day with athletic events for children with special needs) 
- 2018- 2022: Working at Sloepdelen.

Additional Skills:
Microsoft office suite; google suite; scientific writing; creative writing; Stata; collaborative problem solving; interpersonal communication; team leadership; analytical thinking; negotiation strategy

awards.description:
This award is given to the athlete with the highest GPA. Additionally I have been a Four-Year Letterwinner with a cummulative GPA of 3.92
Upon receiving this award I had to speech in front of 800 attendants, that are all associated with Whittier College Athletics.

profile_positions.description: Helping set up and running the Special Olympics tennis event. Working with disabled children aged 6-14.
profile_positions.title: Event Assistant

profile_positions.description: Working on the dock and helping customers get on the boats and answering any questions if necessary. Additionally keeping the boats and dock clean.
profile_positions.title: Dock assistant

profile_positions.description: Helping coach tennis players aged between 10-14 years old. Running practice and figuring out a practice plan.
profile_positions.title: Tennis Coach

profile_positions.description: Two weeks of volunteer work in Cebu City, the Phillipines with the organization Worldmapping. Think about painting classrooms, building a vegetable garden, giving English classes and swimming with handicapped children.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

profile_positions.description: Head soccer coach of children aged 8-10. This job entailed running a practice twice a week and coaching during the matches on Saturdays.
profile_positions.title: Head Soccer Coach
